project.teaser: Automotive safety is one of the most crucial factors in vehicle development and future vehicles need novel, lightweight structures that are safer and sustainable throughout their life-cycle. Hence, the long-term aim for SALIENT is to make our roads safer and reduce serious...
project.objective: Automotive safety is one of the most crucial factors in vehicle development and future vehicles need novel, lightweight structures that are safer and sustainable throughout their life-cycle. Hence, the long-term aim for SALIENT is to make our roads safer and reduce serious injuries and fatalities. To reach this ambition, SALIENT will present novel structural and vehicle concepts that are safer, lighter, circular, and smarter, which can be adapted to accommodate different crash scenarios. SALIENT will focus on innovating new technologies and will develop, demonstrate, and validate the effectiveness of light front-end structure (FES), considering eco-design and circular economy principles, to enhance vehicle safety. SALIENT will adapt advanced light materials, improved manufacturing and joining techniques, innovative circular design, and emerging active safety technologies to develop a smart FES with high energy absorption capability and to be adapted (prior crash events) with future mixed traffic scenarios to meet or exceed future vehicle demands in terms of safety, structural integrity, crashworthiness, and compatibility. SALIENT will build a pathway for the newly accumulated strategic knowledge to impact EU industries and society. Its ambition is to create global impacts and to play a key role to support EU strategic needs, and economic and societal challenges. The consortium consists of twelve partners from seven countries, representing the full automotive value chain, with leading European car manufacturer working alongside world-class research and education organisations, plus innovative SMEs. The project has been engineered to ensure maximum impact for the automotive industry in particular and society as a whole, significantly contributing to the evolving field of automotive safety.
project.title: Novel Concepts for Safer, Lighter, Circular and Smarter Vehicle Structure Design for Enhanced Crashworthiness and Higher Compatibility
project.keywords: Vehicle safety, ADAS, Adaptable front-end structure, Eco-design, Lightweight materials, Manufacturing processes, Virtual testing, Physical Validation, Crashworthiness, Compatibility, Traffic scenarios

result.title: Joining modelling techniques
result.description: Investigating joints modelling techniques, considering the failure behaviour of multi-material joints; Selecting of suitable joining and micromechanics models of the bonded joints; Modelling and simulation of joints including failure assessment under crash loads.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SALIENT (Novel Concepts for Safer, Lighter, Circular and Smarter Vehicle Structure Design forEnhanced Crashworthiness and Higher Compatibility)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: The long-term aim for SALIENT is to make our roads safer and reduce serious injuries and fatalities. To fulfil this ambition, SALIENT has presented novel structural and vehicle concepts that are safer, lighter, circular, and smarter, which can be adapted to accommodate...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Definition of procedures, viability and sustainability
result.description: Feasibility of mass-saving cost vs. structural performance of the developed BCFES/ACFES and asso-ciated developed materials; Identification of cost-effective manufacturing processes and technologi-cal constraints; Sustainability from the LCA perspective; recommendation on component prototype and preparation for production, allowing a minimum number of various realistic tests to be per-formed.

result.title: Full vehicle simulation assessment in mixed accident scenarios
result.description: Analysis of the crash and compatibility behaviour of the vehicles with the redesigned components; Configurations assessment (e.g. frontal, multi-angles crash); Comprehensive set of simulation runs including: Validation of the functional behavior of the developed FES-components in full vehicle crash scenarios; Evaluation of the functional performance and weight saving potential of the FES-components; Assessment of the safety level for the different FES-types in in standard Euro NCAP configurations and additional crash scenarios, derived from future mixed traffic accidents.

result.title: Protocol definition and crash test results
result.description: Detailed description of the new oblique MPDB test protocol; Explaining the trolley based crash test; Full scale of selected BCFES/ACFES crash tests; Defining and evaluating the crashworthiness performance in accordance with the frontal (0º)and oblique crash tests (~10º to ~35º). The number of crash tests will be recognised and finalized during the task.

result.title: FES testing at the component level
result.description: Definition of the simplified tests at component level and tests performed to validate the trigger mechanism (TrM); Activation of the TrM and communication control with the ACFES system’s CAN based controller TrM; Results of different loading cases, tests and material cards validation.

result.title: Layering tailored Shape Memory Alloys into Carbon Fibre-Reinforced Polymer Composites for Enhanced Frontal Impact Creators

details.authors: Mohab Elmarakbi, Ahmed Elmasry, Yongqing Fu, Ahmed Elmarakbi
details.journalTitle: Transport Transitions: Advancing Sustainable and Inclusive Mobility

result.title: Standardization activities
result.description: Analysis and identification of existing standards for the vehicle crashworthiness and compatibility assessment; Updating these standards by taking into account new load cases studied in SALIENT and current legal and consumer test requirements worldwide alongside the EU markets

result.title: Refining Design Approaches and Implementing the Material Matrix Assessment to Foster Structural Components Circularity

details.authors: Ghoniem, Engy; Ventosinos, Vanessa; Moldes Carballal, Miguel
details.journalTitle: Transport Transitions: Advancing Sustainable and Inclusive Mobility. TRAconference 2024

result.title: Advanced Shape Memory Hybrid Composites for Enhancing Crashworthiness

details.authors: Elmasry, Ahmed; Ghoniem, Engy; Azoti, Wiyao; Elmarakbi, Mohab; Yongqing, Fu; elmarakbi, ahmed
details.journalTitle: FISITA World Congress, Sep 2023, Barcelona, Spain

result.title: Accidents and crash configurations of future vehicles in mixed traffic scenarios
result.description: Available accident data load case crash angles collision points overlapping with other vehicles will be used to build a more sophisticated tool to predict traffic scenarios with a special focus on light vehicles and mixed configurations between light vehicles and heavier vehicles Key factors influencing the SAV and AV driving behaviour are mapped in a literature review as well as the impact on safety conditions

result.title: PDER (updated version)
result.description: A final version of the dissemination and exploitation of project results detailing the target audience dissemination methodology editorial to schedule communications exploitation strategies definition of KPIs to measure success and a strategy to monitor progress A full strategy for digital communication and the visual identity of the project

result.title: Dissemination and communication activities (Year 1)
result.description: First annual report on communication and dissemination contains a rundown of all activities taken in the past year and serves at the same time in detailing the work plan for the upcoming year It offers the opportunity to check all KPIs in detail adjust editorials and modify communication strategies if needed

result.title: Open science and data management, sharing plan, and agreement (preliminary version)
result.description: Preliminary version of the Data Management Plan DMP Open sciences and data management plant Protecting the data while they are being collected processed analysed and backedup Ensuring that data obeys with legal regulations Regular reporting to the consortium Monitoring and evaluating database performance Improving the technology used building new databases

result.title: Future Crash Configurations: Analysis of the Impact of Future Vehicles in Mixed Traffic

details.authors: Friederike L. Kühl, José F. Papí
details.journalTitle: Lecture Notes in Mobility, Transport Transitions: Advancing Sustainable and Inclusive Mobility

result.title: Multi-functional design and optimization of materials
result.description: A multilevel multifunctional optimization method for the developed materials including mechanical geometric thermal and acoustic attributes effects of processing on performance damage tolerance and lightweighting

result.title: SALIENT FES concept prototype
result.description: Prototyping of the selected BCFES/ACFES with highly integrated structural elements; Manufactur-ing and assembling using improved manufacturing technologies and several joining technologies; Recommendations on the applicability of FES and associated materials for sustainable and automated production; Optimising the process parameters for the manufacturing of the prototypes.

result.title: Liaison report (final version)
result.description: A final selection of relevant (at least 10) EU initiatives, platforms and networks for maximising SALIEN’s impact on EDC through common events and conferences (+ 100 representatives). Includes report on joint activities and KPI on economic, social and environmental challenges and solutions.

result.title: Rate of production and economies of scale assessment
result.description: Micro-economic analysis contains an assessment of the development of technological processes; Realisation of the FES and verification of the feasibility of the technological processes, processability of the materials developed, and the actual cycle times achievable; Materials and production processes and related to this the viability of cost and production rates; Considering existing value chains and processes from the consortium partners to provide a real-world baseline for the assessment.

result.title: Optimizing the bumper beam and crash box of a vehicle with shape memory alloys for crashworthiness

details.authors: Elmarakbi, Mohab; Elmasry, Ahmed; Yongqing, Fu; elmarakbi, ahmed

result.title: Exploitable results and exploitation activities (Year 3)
result.description: Final annual report of identification and definition of exploitable outputs and results of the project and their related business models for ensuring a successful market readiness stage beyond the project’s completion (> 2025).

result.title: Dissemination and communication activities (Year 2)
result.description: Second annual report on communication and dissemination contains a run-down of all activities taken in the past year and serves at the same time in detailing the work plan for the upcoming year. It offers the opportunity to check all KPIs in detail, adjust editorials and modify communication strategies if needed.

result.title: Shape Memory Alloys (SMAs) based Composites for Automotive Crashworthiness Applications

details.authors: Ghoniem, Engy; Elmasry, Ahmed; Azoti, Wiyao; Elmarakbi, Mohab; Yongqing, Fu; elmarakbi, ahmed

result.title: LCA of identified vehicle's FES
result.description: Full LCA of the vehicle’s FES made with traditional materials and technologies and the ones made of the new proposed solutions; Sensitivity analysis to investigate the effect of changing factors (e.g. materials, manufacturing/joining processes) on the environmental impact.

result.title: Eco-design strategy for the structural components
result.description: A detailed design strategy and plan of the structural modules following the ecodesign principles considering both technical attributes and environmental economic and societal aspects complying with lifecycle principles

result.title: Exploitable results and exploitation activities (Year 2)
result.description: Second annual report of identification and definition of exploitable outputs and results of the project and their related business models for ensuring a successful market readiness stage beyond the project’s completion (> 2025).

result.title: Materials modelling and manufacturing process analysis
result.description: Developing of series of novel materials modelling constitutive laws (CLs), and their implementation in commercial software (e.g. LS-DYNA and RADIOSS); Analysis of quantification of uncertainty and model sensitivity; Modelling of manufacturing processes.

result.title: Exploitable results and exploitation activities (Year 1)
result.description: First annual report of identification and definition of exploitable outputs and results of the project and their related business models for ensuring a successful market readiness stage beyond the projects completion 2025

result.title: Visual identity kit
result.description: The Visual Identity Kit VIK comprises of the launch of a dedicated SALIENT website and social media profiles eg Twitter LinkedIn Youtube as well as the distribution of templates amongst the consortium partners presentations and written reports A full strategy of the visual identity

result.title: PDER (1st version)
result.description: A first draft of the dissemination and exploitation of project results detailing the target audience dissemination methodology editorial to schedule communications exploitation strategies definition of KPIs to measure success and a strategy to monitor progress A full strategy for digital communication and the visual identity of the project

result.title: Evaluation of materials characterizations
result.description: The methodology followed to determine the different properties of all developed materials Detailed information of the properties measured full testing and cauterization analysis and evaluations

result.title: Liaison report (1st ver.)
result.description: A preliminary mapping of relevant (at least 20) EU initiatives, platforms and networks that could help maximising SALIEN’s impact on EDC. Methodology for exchanging outputs and ideas is set up based on best practices, including communication among related stakeholders.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
